bug.author: LukasDauterman
bug.summary: Down loading embeddings returns redirect error for Alan NLP
bug.description:
I am trying to load flair embeddings and I keep getting the following error: OSError: HEAD request failed for url https://s3.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com/alan-nlp/resources/embeddings/glove.gensim.vectors.npy with status code 301. The status code indicates a permanent redirect. I SSH into the machine that is exhibiting this issue, so there is no network issues that I can think of. The code that produces this issue for me : <denchmark-code>embedding_types: List[TokenEmbeddings] = [ WordEmbeddings('glove'), FlairEmbeddings('news-forward-fast'), FlairEmbeddings('news-backward-fast') ] </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3969402/98983559-cb289300-24d5-11eb-8706-27732164b0aa.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3969402/98983606-ded3f980-24d5-11eb-9256-830b6583ce59.png></denchmark-link>
But this doesn't work and throws the error, and I get similar errors for all the different embeddings. Environment:
OS : linux Python: 3.7 Flair: 0.4.5 (have to use this version) Using visual studio code and remote ssh.
This is running in a VM in Azure resources, but can't give more details than that. I have tried looking for where I can download the models, but it has a similar issue, shows a redirect error: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3969402/98983742-1478e280-24d6-11eb-8c6b-55694438fdea.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/LukasDauterman>@LukasDauterman</denchmark-link> the bucket was unfortunately taken offline, which is why you need to use a newer version of Flair where the new bucket is used. As a workaround, you could install current Flair in a different virtual environment, execute this code once so that the models are downloaded, then go back to using Flair 0.4.5.
Alternatively, you could manually download the models from here: <denchmark-link:https://nlp.informatik.hu-berlin.de/resources/>https://nlp.informatik.hu-berlin.de/resources/</denchmark-link>
I ended up updating to the current version and that fixed the issue, but required some code changes.
